name: Hotel Bon Port

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at Bon Port as part of a 'voucher deal'. On entering the .Hotel the reception, bar and dining area were nicely decorated. But this is where it ended. Going through the door to the bedrooms was a time warp. The corridors were lined with chairs, giving the appearance and feeling of an old people's care home (in fact this is probably an insult to modern care homes!). As we were on this deal we had to accept pot luck as to the room we were allocated. Unfortunately this was at the back of the building. The view was of flat roofs, rubbish skip, bonfire, washing line and several old freezer cabinets. Ok look beyond this and there are trees in the distance. The room décor was very tired and dated. The plus side is that it was immaculately clean and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. There were sufficient towels and basic toiletries. The shower was above the bath and was the clip on hand held type. There was absolutely no power and when my husband showered the hot water ran out.
reviews.title: An Hotel cannot survive on view alone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main air conditioning unit outlet seemed to be very near to the outside of the window and was extremely noisy in the quiet of the night, making sleep difficult. This was pointed out to the receptionist who said she would pass this on to the management.
reviews.title: Amazing Location!

reviews.text: The evening meal was okay. Certainly not fine dining and the average good home cook could produce the meal. The vegetables were cooked just right. Breakfast was a good buffet choice with either a cooked English or Fish dish available.
reviews.title: Wonderful views, spectacular situation but restaurant problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very helpful and friendly which made the stay more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Disappointing conclusion to a stunning summers day

reviews.text: Would we stay there again - certainly not in the back of the building!
reviews.title: Brilliant, flexible, friendly service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the Jubilee weekend. The hotel benefits from superb views over the bay to the Peastacks but it should also be mentioned that it is a nice hotel to stay in with good, efficient staff. Breakfast was very nice and the room was clean and spacious. A very nice place to spend a few days as there is a pool and superb garden facilities.
reviews.title: Nice Enough, superb views
Best location and great staff
reviews.text: A week in this paradise is ideal to de- stress. The cliff top views of Petit port from the balcony rooms is unbeatable with Jersey beyond- on a clear day. The rooms with a view over the car park do not benefit from this view. Breakfast was generous, well made and efficiently served. Staff were lovely and would go to any length to accommodate our needs. When faced with an unusually (and unnecessarily) awkward type they displayed reserves of civility above and beyond the call. Indeed they were visibly shaken by the experience yet maintained a level of personable presence that was by any standards commendable. Said Saeed? Folds a mean napkin but then his ancestors could build pyramids. There are ifs and buts just like pretty much anywhere but with this setting and the lovely staff you won't care!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband recently surprised me for a "significant" birthday by booking a few days holiday in Guernsey. As our faithful pooch (Haggis) goes pretty much everywhere with us, he needed to make sure the accommodation would accept him also - step in and take a bow Hotel Bon Port! It did take a few wrong turns on some very narrow roads before we found the place but it was sure worth waiting for. Set high on a clifftop, the views are simply stunning. There is plenty space surrounding the hotel for both humans and dogs alike to enjoy walking, playing or just generally relaxing. Our room was downstairs and to the side but even the view from this window was quite lovely as it overlooked the next bay along. The room itself and en-suite were clean, spacious and very comfortable - more than adequate for our needs. So imagine our surprise (and sheer delight) when we got a call from reception to say that they were going to upgrade us to one of the even better rooms upstairs with a balcony and view to die for! This room was even more spacious and grand. We stayed at the Bon Port for 4 nights and after staying in some really nice hotels all over the world, I can honestly say this is one of the best. This is a family run hotel and the staff are very well chosen because they go above and beyond just providing good service. Nothing was ever too much trouble and I even got a lovely card, balloon and birthday cake from them on my special day. It's touches like these that make all the difference between a great stay and an unforgettable stay. We certainly have some fab memories (and pictures) from this trip that will last a lifetime and it's largely thanks to the management and staff at the Hotel Bon Port. Could not recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Amazing views and fab overall experience!

reviews.text: Visited this hotel as part of a group with great expectations having seen its location last year and even sampling its cream tea which I thought was excellent LAST year.
reviews.title: Great Location but disappointing management and food poor!

reviews.text: However although the location remains superb, after a stay of several days I would NOT recommend it as I think it needs serious improvement in its General management for the following reasons.
reviews.title: A fabulous welcome, and views to die for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My finace and I stopped here for morning coffee and were greeted by some extremely friendly staff, including the new owner. He was extremely polite and professional as well as hugely personable. Wanting just coffee, we wondered what reaction we would get, but the owner made us feel as though we were his most important guests. Within a few moments of ordering, some delicious coffee was brought to us on the terrace and we sat drinking looking over what are most probably the best coastal scenic views on the Island. Stunning does not even start to describe the views. The price for the coffee was extremely good and the views were free!! The toilets were very clean and smelt lovely, with some high class hand wash lotions etc available.
reviews.title: Under New Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chatting to the new owner we found someone who appeared to care enormously that his guests were the most important part of his business and that their holiday should be as perfect as he could possibly make it. We were very impressed and look forward to staying at Bon Port on a future visit. Good luck with your venture - we are sure you will make a huge success of it.
reviews.title: Awesome views, very attentive staff

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on a Guernsey Treats deal (dinner, B&B in a sea view room). I would definitely rate the hotel as a 3+ stars hotel and not just 3. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and professional. Room very clean, well appointed, comfy bed. The view was fantastic and the balcony a good size. The whole atmosphere was absolutely delightful. The only thing which I thought was not on the same standard as all the other things, was the food. Good menu and nice presentation but it just lacked that little something extra (which we experienced with everything else). Maybe I was just expecting too much, being so spoilt already! Would definitely stay again and will receoomend to all my friends.
reviews.title: Stunning location

reviews.text: Stayed here for a wedding. Location is stunning, the staff really friendly with exceptional service - the receptionist must have spent 20 mins telephoning all the local nail spas to try and get me an appointment.
reviews.title: Beautiful view! Warm friendly welcome! Excellent service!

reviews.text: The wedding breakfast which was excellent. All guests were offered a choice for each of the 3 courses in advance and it was all served together and of high quality.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel and breathtaking scenery

reviews.text: Bon Port occupies what is probably the prime spot on the island but consistently gets it wrong by appalling service in its restaurant/on the terrace. Arrived at 1.50, finally got menus 25 mins later to be told "we stop serving at 2.00". Many other customers frustrated not to be able to drinks/food/bills. Such a shame because it could and should be so good.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but appalling service
Excellent!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for family wedding. I am disabled and walk with crutches and the staff (especially the wonderful lady on Reception, Claire, I think) were SO helpful. They could not do enough for us. Breakfast was good, room was adequate, staff were brilliant. Wedding breakfast was amazing. The whole family had a great time. First trip to Guernsey and it won't be our last! Thanks again to Claire for making our trip so wonderful, I cannot praise her enough. Angel & Gary from Bristol.
We could not fault the location or the view it was superb.
reviews.title: Superb location but very poor food and management

reviews.text: When we arrived they were clearing away following a wedding at the weekend and this may have been part of the reason that our experience did not meet those of the people who have reviewed this hotel before us.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: We found this hotel whilst out driving and decided to stay for lunch. We were disappointed when we were told that they were not offering the set lunch menu on that day so we had to select from the a la carte.
reviews.title: Amazing view!

description: In March 2011 the new management reopened The Bon Port Hotel, after a change in property ownership, and we have invested money to improve and develop the hotel. The Hotel is situated in the midst of Guernsey's most beautiful coastal scenery, boasting spectacular views over Moulin Huet Bay, Peastacks, Saints Bay and the island of Jersey. We now have a heated outdoor swimming pool, gym operated by our personal trainer and seperate sauna. In 2014 we are opening our new conference facility for smaller conferences and as a training facility.
